courses.danishTitle: Kommercialisering af high tech koncepter,iværksætteri og videnskab  i aktion
courses.danishContents: See English
courses.englishTitle: Commercialization of high tech concepts, entrepreneurship and science in action

courses.englishContents: Several DTU scientists working on an innovative early-stage technology have been identified prior to the start of this class (student’s own projects/inventions are possible, too). They will present their projects early in the course, and we will form student teams around these projects. As team heterogeneity plays a major role in opportunity identification, the lecturer will define the teams according to the individuals’ backgrounds. Each team is expected to creatively identify several market applications for the technology and evaluate their attractiveness. For the most promising idea, a firm creation roadmap will be developed. Each team is expected to come up with market opportunities that are innovative and that offer a real potential for high-growth and value creation. The opportunities should be an original effort of your team, not a copy or rework of someone else’s concept. The final goal is to develop a document detailing market assessments, the primary market opportunity and a firm creation roadmap. Overall, students will need to submit 4 assignments:1)	Team Presentation 1: Presentation of your core technology and your Market Opportunity Set 2)	Team Presentation 2: Present the evaluation of 3-4 Market Opportunities and your preferred choice3)	Team Presentation 3: Present your primary market opportunity in details and your Agile Focus Strategy 4)	Final report: Describe in details the 3 steps of the Market Opportunity Navigator and your primary market opportunity
courses.danishTitle: Identifikation af markedsmuligheder for ny teknologi
courses.danishContents: Kurset beskæftiger sig med en række teknologier udviklet af DTU forskere der befinder sig på et tidligt udviklingsstadie. Disse teknologier vil blive præsenteret af forskerene tidligt i kursets forløb, og deltagerne vil blive opdelt i grupper og tildelt en af disse teknologier (alternativt kan gruppen vælge at arbejde med en egenudviklet teknologi). Dette vil ske i blandede, heterogene grupper, tildelt af kursets undervisere baseret på deltagernes baggrund. Dette sker da en bred viden og samarbejde på tværs af tekniske discipliner spiller en stor rolle i identifikation af muligheder for den enkelte teknologi. Det forventes at hver gruppe identificerer flere forskellige markedsmuligheder for den tildelte teknologi og evaluere disse muligheders kommercielle potentiale. Der udvikles herefter et roadmap for den mest lovende mulighed. Det forventes at hver gruppe finder kreative og innovative markedsmuligheder med potentiale for høj vækst og værdiskabelse i markedet. Disse muligheder skal være nye og originale, og ikke en omskrivning eller kopi af eksisterende løsninger i markedet. Formålet med kurset er at producere en detaljeret markedsanalyse der identificerer den primære markedsmulighed, fordele og ulemper ved denne, samt et endeligt roadmap for hvordan denne mulighed skal udnyttes og teknologien kommercialiseres.Kurset består af fire afleveringer:1.	Gruppe præsentation #1: En præsentation af teknologien og de identificerede markedsmuligheder2.	Gruppe præsentation #2: Præsentation af gruppens evaluering af 3-4 markedsmuligheder og gruppens valg af marked3.	Gruppe præsentation #3: Detaljeret præsentation af den primære markedsmulighed og gruppens udviklede Agile Focus Strategy4.	Endelig rapport: Rapporten beskriver i detaljer de 3 trin af Market Opportunity Navigator og hvordan dette er brugt til at identificere den primære markedsmulighed

courses.englishContents: The course is based on the completion of a project regarding the analysis and quantification of complexity costs. The project work will focus on one or more of the following elements:Principles of complexity management.Procedure for analysis and quantification of complexity costs of products and business processes. Identification and quantification of initiatives for reducing complexity of products and business processes.Students will have to prepare a project report, describing the project task and the project results.
courses.danishContents: Kurset er baseret på gennemførelse af et projekt vedr. analyse og kvantificering af kompleksitetsomkostninger. Projektarbejdet vil fokusere på et eller flere af følgende elementer:Principper i complexity management.Fremgangsmåde for analyse og kvantificering af kompleksitetsomkostninger i produkter og forretningsprocesser. Identifikation og kvantificering af tiltag til at reducere kompleksitet i produkter og forretningsprocesser.Der udarbejdes en projektrapport, der beskriver projektopgaven og projektets resultater.

courses.englishContents: Headlines for the lectures• Introduction to strategy from an engineers point of view• Analysing the Environment of the firm• Exploring strategic differentiation of organisations applying the Quadric framework• The theory of generic strategies • Diversification and strategy directions• Corporate identity and culture• The Resource Based View and Strategic Capabilities• Strategic scenarios• Technology Roadmapping
courses.danishContents: Headlines for the lectures• Introduction to strategy from an engineers point of view• Analysing the Environment of the firm• Exploring strategic differentiation of organisations applying the Quadric framework• The theory of generic strategies • Diversification and strategy directions• Corporate identity and culture• The Resource Based View and Strategic Capabilities• Strategic scenarios• Technology Roadmapping

courses.englishContents: This course encompasses literature on strategy and planning in organisations, interactive learning processes and a number of concrete strategy and planning methods, such as Future Workshop, Scenario Analysis, Strategic Roadmapping and Causal Mapping. The methods are applied by the students through exercises following each lecture. Additionally, the students have to work in depth with one method, which they apply to a real organisation or user group’s needs. The students gain knowledge and practical experience in planning and facilitating workshops for a user group. Skills that are commonly exercised by engineers in relation to product and organisation development, IT-development, as well as consultants within private and public sectors.
courses.danishContents: Dette kursus introducerer til litteratur om strategi og planlægning i organisationer samt interaktive læringsprocesser og giver den studerende en række konkrete strategi- og planlægningsmetoder, såsom Future Workshop, Scenario Analysis, , Strategic Roadmapping, og Causal Mapping. De studerende får mulighed for at arbejde med alle metoderne gennem øvelser efter hver forelæsning. Derudover skal de studerende udvælge én metode, som de skal applicerer i en organisation eller konkret brugergruppe tilpasset deres behov. De studerende får herigennem viden og praktisk erfaring i at planlægge og facilitere workshops for en brugergruppe.

courses.englishContents: This course approaches the management of technological innovation from a resource/knowledge based view, which sees technological innovations as a driving force of competitive advantage of organizations through a combination of internal resources and external linkages. Students are introduced to the theories, models, tools and practical cases from industries by understanding what technological innovations are, why they are important, and what are needed to enable and manage technological innovations within and outside of the boundary of organizations. Although most attention will be paid to innovations made by industrial firms, relevant issues of innovations at levels of individual, team, network of organizations, and industry will be addressed as well. The weekly readings consist of a mixture of book chapters, journal articles, and cases. In addition to ‘understanding’ technological innovations, students are also required to ‘practice’ innovations by developing a case study throughout the course and applying the knowledge learned from the course to the self-generated innovation case.
courses.danishContents: Dette kursus anvender det ressource- og videns-baserede perspektiv til at studere innovation og innovationsledelse, og ser teknologisk innovation som en kilde til konkurrencemæssige fordele for organisationer gennem en kombination af interne ressourcer og eksterne relationer.De studerende bliver introduceret til teorier, modeller, værktøjer og relevante cases der har til formål at præsentere hvad teknologisk innovation er, hvorfor det er relevant og hvad der kræves for at muliggøre og styre teknologisk innovation både i og udenfor organisationer. Selvom det primære fokus er på innovation i teknologi-baserede virksomheder, arbejdes der også med innovation på andre niveauer, bl.a. individer, grupper, netværk og brancher.Pensum består af bogkapitler, videnskabelige artikler og cases.Ud over at opnå en teoretisk forståelse for teknologisk innovation, skal de studerende arbejde praktisk med innovation gennem løbende udvikling af en case.

courses.englishContents: The classes are taught in an interactive manner, with theoretical parts, intermingled with practice with Jupyter Notebooks. Main topics are: Introduction to Python programming and Pandas, data visualisation, forecasting and regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction. The methods will be exemplified through different cases within e.g. transportation, management and marketing.
courses.danishContents: The classes are taught in an interactive manner, with theoretical parts, intermingled with practice with Jupyter Notebooks. Main topics are: Introduction to Python programming and Pandas, data visualisation, forecasting and regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction. The methods will be exemplified through different cases within e.g. transportation, management and marketing.

courses.englishContents: The course is an introduction to engineering work with focus on the following topics:• planning and decision support• strategy and systems design • etichs and sustainability• energy systems and transport systems • group work including giving / receiving feedback • self-management in study planning
courses.danishContents: Kurset er en introduktion til ingeniørarbejde med fokus på følgende emner:• planlægning og beslutningsstøtte• strategi og systemdesign • etik og bæredygtighed• energisystemer og transportsystemer• gruppearbejde herunder give/modtage feedback• selvledelse i studieplanlægning

courses.englishContents: The topics in the course will depend on the selected project. The detailed contents of the projects are defined in collaboration between the students and the supervisor. Project subjects are published before course start. The students may suggest projects themselves and find supervisors at DTU Management or DTU Compute.
courses.danishContents: Kursets faglige indhold vil afhænge af det valgte projekt. Projektets indhold vælges af de studerende og vejledere i fællesskab. Forslag til emner offentliggøres inden kursusstart. De studerende kan desuden selv foreslå projekter og finde vejledere ved DTU Management  eller DTU Compute. Hvis der ønskes en vejleder fra et andet institut, skal emnet godkendes af den kursusansvarlige.
courses.englishTitle: Project work - Strategic Analysis and Systems Design

courses.englishContents: During the course, the planning problems and corresponding solution methods seen within the primary activities of a company will be discussed. These includes:- Supply chain management (SCM) and operations management (OM) exemplified through the learning game "The Beer Game"- Production processes, layout of production systems and Business Process Management- Quality and capacity management- Management of supplies - Logistics- Forecasting- Sales and Operations Planning- Inventory management- Production PlanningBoth the weekly exercises and the mandatory project assignments will be carried out using the Microsoft Excel spreadsheet software. These include basic data management as well as simple formula expressions, visualization (graphs and figures) and solving simple optimization problems using Microsoft Excel Solver.
courses.danishTitle: Introduktion til Operations og Supply Chain Management
courses.danishContents: Gennem kurset gennemgås de enkelte faglige problemstillinger og tilhørende løsningsmetoder inden for virksomhedernes primære aktiviteter. Dette omfatter:-	Forsyningskæder og operations management eksemplificeret gennem læringsspillet ”The Beer Game” -	Produktionsprocesser, layout af produktionssystemer og Business Process Management-	Kvalitets- og kapacitetsstyring-	Styring af indkøb-	Logistik-	Forecasting-	Sales and Operations Planning-	Lagerstyring-	ProduktionsplanlægningSåvel de ugentlige øvelsesopgaver som de obligatoriske projektopgaver vil blive gennemført i regnearkssoftwaren Microsoft Excel og omfatter såvel grundlæggende datahåndtering som simple formeludtryk, visualisering (grafer og figurer) samt løsning af simple optimeringsproblemer ved hjælp af Microsoft Excel Solver.
courses.englishTitle: Introduction to Operations and Supply Chain Management

courses.englishContents: The course consists of theoretical lectures and group discussions. The lectures will pertain to matters of -philosophy of science-logic-ethics and (other types of) normativity-values in engineering, e.g. risks and sustainability
courses.danishContents: Kurset består af teoretiske forelæsninger og gruppediskussioner. Forelæsningerne vil omhandle følgende fire temaer, hvor argumentation og korrekt ræsonnering er gennemgående: - Videnskabsfilosofi. - Logik. - Etik og andre former for normativitet. - Ingeniørarbejde med værdier, særligt sikkerhed og bæredygtighed.

courses.englishContents: The course covers all of the topics contained within a modern investor pitch deck and business plan.  In addition, we cover topics related to technology risk mitigation, product/service-systems, pretotyping and MVPs, IPR, financing, value propositions, business modelling, segmentation & market estimation.  The cases are submitted by industry and research institutes.  The cases are in the form of a patent/technology or a technology related challenge. Every team will be joined by the inventor (project submitter) for the technical development and also a business mentor.The cases fall into two categories: Commercial Entrepreneurship and Social Entrepreneurship relating to the SDGs.  We will try to fit students to the category they are most interested in.The final deliverable of the course is the business pitch deck.  The course ends with spinout day where the students make a 4min business pitch plus 2 min tech demo in front of your examiners, investors and an audience.The business pitch deck has been approved for submission of the venture cup and the Danish tech challenge and can be submitted to both competitions on completion. There is also prototype fund available for each team.
courses.danishContents: Kurset inkluderer alle de emner, man kan forvente at finde i en moderne investorpræsentation og forretningsplan. Derudover dækkes en række emner inden for håndtering af teknologiske risici, produkt/service-systemer, pretotyping og MVP'er, immaterielle rettigheder, value proposition, forretningsmodellering, segmentering- og estimering af marked.De enkelte cases kommer fra industrien og fra forskningsinstitutter. De er i form af patenter/teknologier eller i form af en teknologisk udfordring. "Opfinderen" (som er kommet med teknologien) bliver del af teamet med henblik på at støtte den tekniske udvikling og desuden bliver der påsat en forretningsorienteret mentor.Projekterne falder i to kategorier: Kommercielt eller Socialt iværksætteri - sidstnævnte med fokus på FNs SDG'er. Vi forsøger at placere de studerende i den type projekt de helst vil arbejde med.Kursets afsluttende aflevering er et "business pitch deck". Kurset ender med den såkaldte spin out day, hvor de studerende præsentere dette pitch deck i 4 min sammen med en 2 min lang teknologidemonstration. Dette foregår foran eksaminatorer, investorer og et større publikum.Business pitch deck'et er desuden godkendt til brug i ansøgning til både Venture Cup og Danish Tech Challenge og det derfor blive indsendt til disse konkurrencer efter kurset er afsluttet. Der er endvidere en prototypefond til rådighed for hvert team.

courses.englishContents: The following topics will be adressed:- research design and philosophy- research methods including qualitative, quantitative and mixed-methods- managing a PhD project- Academic writing and publishing- Ethics in academic research
courses.danishTitle: Research and PhD studies at DTU Management
courses.danishContents: The following topics will be adressed:- research design and philosophy- research methods including qualitative, quantitative and mixed-methods- managing a PhD project- Academic writing and publishing- Ethics in academic research
courses.englishTitle: Research and PhD studies at DTU Management

courses.englishContents: Sessions: 1: Introduction2: The role of gas in the energy system3: Gasification4: Anaerobic digestion5: Ongoing research6: Biogas upgrading and gas quality7: Gas motors8: Gas market and regulation 9: Power-to-gas and smart grids
courses.danishContents: Sessioner: 1: Introduktion2: Gassens rolle i energisystemet3: Termisk forgasning4: Anaerob forgasning5: Igangværende forskning6: Biogas opgradering og gas kvalitet7: Gas motorer8: Gas marked og regulering 9: Power-to-gas og smart grids
courses.englishTitle: Renewable gas in the energy system

courses.englishContents: Theoretical background for road traffic engineering, simulation of road transport, model integration in simulation programs and evaluation of solutions.
courses.danishContents: Teoretisk baggrund for vejtrafikteknik, simulering af vejtrafik, modelopbygning i simuleringsprogrammer og evaluering af løsninger.

courses.englishContents: The course treats both basic and advanced theory and methodology in assessment/appraisal/evaluation of major investment projects for transport infrastructure. The methodologies applied are, however, universal and can be applied to other types of projects as well. Knowledge about transport infrastructure projects is not a prerequisite to participate in the course.The overall issue of the course is to apply socio-economic analysis using cost-benefit analysis (CBA), strategic analysis using multi-criteria decision analysis (MCDA) and risk analysis and combine them to a composite analysis for a pool of investment projects in order to provide the best possible decision support. The following topics will be treated in lectures and exercises, where it is assumed that the student holds some basic knowledge in economics:Socio-economic analysis: Basic methodology behind the CBA. The students will learn how to apply the methodology to analyse major investments over a long-time horizon.Strategic analysis: Theory and methodology concerning the measurement of non-quantifiable impacts, which often are of a strategic character and hold the potential of improving the decision support. The students will get acquainted with different MCDA assessment techniques to be used depending on the decision situation, and how to combine these with the results stemming from the cost-benefit analysis and risk analysis.Risk analysis: Theory and methodology concerning uncertainty calculations and the concept of Optimism Bias. A topic here is the determination of various uncertain elements in the socio-economic analysis.Sustainability: The Sustainable Development Goals defined by UN in 2015 have pushed for a new agenda when performing decision support, and a wide set of indicators are defined to measure the contribution of a project initiative to achieve one or more of the goals. In the course the aim is to include this sustainability perspective in the final recommendations as well.The course participants work in groups to apply and achieve practical knowledge about the analysis methods and concepts. It is expected that the students are able to clarify/account/argue for the chosen impacts/criteria and the model solutions in connection with the report work and the oral examination. The main course content consists of lectures and group exercises with plenary discussions.
courses.danishContents: Kurset omhandler den basale teori samt metodegrundlag m.h.t. vurdering/evaluering af større investeringsprojekter. Der tages udgangspunkt i infrastrukturprojekter, men de anvendte metoder er imidlertid universelle og et kendskab til transportprojekter er ikke en forudsætning for at kunne følge kurset.Hovedformålet med kurset vil være at kunne anvende samfundsøkonomisk analyse vha. cost-benefit analyse (CBA), strategisk analyse vha. multi-kriterie analyse (MCDA) samt risikoanalyse og kombinere dem til en komposit analyse for et specifikt investeringsprojekt.  Følgende emner vil blive behandlet i forelæsninger og øvelser, hvor det forudsættes at den studerende har basalt kendskab til økonomisk teori: Samfundsøkonomisk analyse: Grundlæggende metode bag CBA. Kursusdeltagerne vil lære at anvende metoden til at analyse store investeringer over en længere tidshorisont.Strategisk analyse: Teori og metode vedrørende måling af ikke-kvantificerbare effekter, som ofte er af strategisk karakter og kan medvirke til at forbedre beslutningsstøtten. Kursusdeltagerne vil få kendskab til forskellige MCDA vurderingsteknikker, der kan anvendes afhængig af beslutningssituationen, samt viden om, hvordan disse kan kombineres med resultaterne fra risikoanalysen.Risikoanalyse: Teori og metode vedrørende usikkerhedsberegninger og såkaldt ”optimism bias”. Herudover lægges der vægt på bestemmelse af usikre elementer/effekter i den samfundsøkonomiske analyse. Kursusdeltagerne vil arbejde med ovennævnte metoder og begreber i grupper. Det forventes, at de studerende vil kunne tydeliggøre/redegøre for de valgte effekter/kriterier og den resulterende modelløsning i forbindelse med såvel afrapportering som den mundtlige eksamen. Hovedkursusindholdet vil bestå af forelæsninger og gruppeøvelser inkl. plenumdiskussioner og præsentationer.

courses.englishContents: The course applies statistical concepts and models used for analysis of transport and mobility data as well as other social data. The course is organised around four modules. The first relates to data management and applied statistics. The second concerns applied linear regression in a societal context. The third applies generalised linear models to social data, e.g. traffic safety data, and the final module consists of a project that applies relevant models to a self chosen data set.
courses.danishTitle: Statistisk analyse af mobilitet og transport
courses.danishContents: Kurset introducerer statistiske metoder, som anvendes til modellering af data vdr. samfundet, herunder mobilitet og transport. Kurset er organiseret omkring fire moduler. Det første modul omhandler databehandling og anvendt statistik. Den næste omhandler anvendt lineær regression på samfundsmæssige problemstillinger. Det tredje omhandler modellering af data vha. generaliserede lineære modeller. I det sidste modul anvendes relevante modeller på et selvvalgt datasæt.
courses.englishTitle: Statistical analysis of mobility and transport

courses.englishContents: Overview of the various logistics problems in shipping and ports. The international, regional and sectoral policy context. Innovation drivers and triggers in maritime logistics sectors. Tramp and liner shipping logistics basics. Speed optimization and combined speed-routing models. Weather routing. Liner shipping network design. Balancing environmental vs. economic performance. Greenhouse gas and sulphur abatement and their impact on maritime logistics. Port logistics basics. Port governance models. Generalized costs and hinterland connections. Terminal management problems. Port security. Green ports. Cross-linkages between ship and port logistics. Autonomous shipping and digitalization. Maritime cyber-security.The course assignment will be each student (or student groups) to critically review a number of related papers, and work on a final project that will address a major shipping or port logistics challenge.
courses.danishContents: Oversigt over de forskellige logistikproblemer i shipping og havne. Den internationale, regionale og sektorpolitiske kontekst. Innovationsdrivere og udløsere i maritime logistik sektorer. Tramp og linje shipping i grundlæggende logistik. Hastighedsoptimering og kombinerede speed-routing modeller. Vejr routing, liner shipping og network design. Afbalancering af miljøet mod økonomiske resultater. Drivhusgas og svovlbekæmpelse og deres indvirkning på søfartslogistik. Port logistik basics. Port governance modeller. Generelle omkostninger og bagvedliggende forbindelser. Terminal management problemer. Havnesikring, Grønne havne og koblinger mellem skibs- og havlogistik. Autonome forsendelser og digitalisering. Maritime cybersikkerhed.Kursusopgaven vil være udformet således at hver elev (eller elevgrupper) kritisk gennemgår en række relaterede artikler og arbejder på et endeligt projekt, der skal tage højde for en stor shipping- eller portlogistikudfordring.

courses.englishContents: Work with topics within planning and public transport. Introduction to the role of public transport in transport planning. Characteristics and effects of various public transport systems. Need assessments for implementation of public transport. Station vicinity. Data sources and data collection. Public transport organization. Design and planning of public transport networks and timetable planning, amongst other introduction to tools and methods. Intelligent Transport Systems in public transport. Passenger preferences and satisfaction.
courses.danishContents: Der arbejdes med emner inden for planlægning af kollektiv transport. Introduktion til kollektiv transports rolle i overordnet trafikplanlægning. Karakteristika og effekter af forskellige kollektive transportsystemer. Behovsanalyser for implementering af kollektiv transport. Stationsnærhed. Datakilder og dataindsamling. Organisering af kollektiv transport. Udformning og planlægning af kollektive transportnetværk og køreplanlægning, herunder introduktion til værktøjer og metoder. Intelligente transportsystemer inden for kollektiv transport. Passagerpræferencer og -tilfredshed.

courses.englishContents: The theory of the 4-stage model is presented.Route choice calculations are performed using Traffic Analyst and ArcGIS for a small test network as preparation for the project work.A road project in the Metropolitan area is coded, modelled and evaluated with respect to the traffic impacts. This includes specification of the project, overall need analysis, choice and coding of the alignment, estimating construction costs, calculation of route choice, induced traffic and other traffic impacts. The road project is evaluated by means of a cost-benefit analysis.
courses.danishContents: Teorien bag 4-trins modellen gennemgåes. Rutevalgsberegninger gennemføres med Traffic Analyst og ArcGIS på et testnetværk som forberedelse til projektarbejdet.Et vejprojekt i Hovedstadsregionen kodes, modelleres og trafikkonsekvensvurderes. Dette inkluderer projektkonkretisering, overordnet behovsanalyse, valg og kodning af linieføring, estimat af anlægsomkostning, beregning af rutevalg, trafikspring og øvrige transporteffekter. Vejprojektet vurderes vha. en cost-benefit analyse.

courses.englishContents: Theoretical background for road traffic technique, simulation of road transport, model integration in simulation programs and evaluation of solutions.
courses.danishContents: Teoretisk baggrund for vejtrafikteknik, simulering af vejtrafik, modelopbygning i simuleringsprogrammer og evaluering af løsninger.

courses.englishContents: The course covers the basic theory and methodology with regard to the assessment/evaluation of a transport project. The main objective will be to apply the concept of sustainability and cost-benefit analysis within a specific transport-related problem area. The students will in this context be introduced to socio-economic assessments including a number of software solutions. The following topics will be addressed in lectures and exercises:Sustainability: the 3 dimensions consisting of environmental, social aspects and economy are introduced and operationalized in the transport sector. It is outlined what sustainable transport solutions consist of, and how the Danish planning process can be developed in a more sustainable direction.Cost-benefit analysis (CBA): Review of relevant concepts and terms such as net present value, the benefit/cost ratio, internal rate of return, discounting, etc.. Involvement of transport-related effects such as travel time savings, construction costs, maintenance and operation, environmental aspects, etc.. The analytical method will be based on the spreadsheet model, TERESA (Ministry of Transport Spreadsheet Model for Socio-economic Analysis). Finally, special attention is paid to the provision of appropriate and relevant input data as well as key figures from the latest key figure catalog for transport economic unit prices.Qualitative analyses of the transport effects that cannot be assigned monetary values. Point of departure is taken in EIA (Environmental Impact Assessments)  and their use in the planning process.
courses.danishContents: Kurset omhandler den basale teori samt metodegrundlag m.h.t. vurdering/evaluering af et transportprojekt. Hovedformålet vil være at kunne anvende bæredygtighedsbegrebet og cost-benefit analyse på et specifikt transportrelateret problemområde. Den studerende vil i denne sammenhæng blive introduceret for samfundsøkonomiske vurderinger bl.a. ved hjælp af en softwareløsning. Følgende emner vil blive behandlet i forelæsninger og øvelser:Bæredygtighed: de 3 dimensioner bestående af miljø, sociale aspekter og økonomi introduceres og operationaliseres inden for transportområdet. Der redegøres for hvad bæredygtige transportløsninger er, og hvordan den danske planlægningsproces kan udvikle sig i en mere bæredygtig retning.Cost-benefit analyse (CBA): Gennemgang af relevante koncepter og begreber såsom nettonutidsværdi, nettogevinst pr. offentlig omkostningskrone, den interne rente, diskontering mv. Inddragelse af transportrelaterede effekter såsom rejsetidsbesparelser, anlægsomkostninger, vedligehold og drift, miljømæssige aspekter, mv. Analysemetoden vil tage udgangspunkt i regnearksmodellen, TERESA (Transportministeriets Regnearksmodel for Samfundsøkonomisk Analyse). Endelig lægges der særlig vægt på tilvejebringelse af passende og relevant input data samt nøgletal fra det seneste nøgletalskatalog for transportøkonomiske enhedspriser.Kvalitative analyser af de transporteffekter der ikke umiddelbart kan prissættes. Herunder tages udgangspunkt i VVM (Vurdering af Virkninger på Miljøet) redegørelser og deres anvendelse i planlægningsprocessen.

courses.englishContents: Cost of Energy, role of the electricity stock, economical feasibility versus political goodwill. Statistical distribution of mean wind speed, the atmospheric boundary layer and velocity profile, turbulence and the terrains influence on the local wind conditions, annual production. Methods for wind measurement. The evolution of wind turbine technology, the components of a wind turbine. 1D momentum theory for flow through the rotor, maximum energy yield, thrust and power coefficient, the velocity triangle for a wind turbine blade, the principle behind the BEM method. Simple beam-formulae for the tower motion, natural frequency and structural resonance, sectional forces and moments in blades and tower. Galileis square-cube law for stresses, design/choice of composite materials, principles for application of electron microscopy for characterization of metals and composite materials. Generator types and their working principle, the mechanical-electrical coupling between rotor and grid, transmission, the balancing problem on the grid. Introduction to advanced courses and research in wind energy.
courses.danishContents: Cost of Energy, elmarkedets rolle, økonomisk rentabilitet versus politisk goodwill. Statistisk fordeling af middelvindhastighed, det atmosfæriske grænselag og hastighedsprofil, turbulens og terrænnets indflydelse på lokale vindforhold, årlig produktion. Metoder for vindmåling. Vindmølleteknologiens udvikling, vindmøllens opbygning og komponenter. 1D momentum teori for flow gennem rotor, maksimal virkningsgrad, thrust og power koefficient, hastighedstrekant for et vindmølleblad, princippet bag BEM metoden. Simple bjælkeformler for vindmølletårnets bevægelse, egenfrekvens og strukturel resonans, snitkræfter i vinger og tårn. Galileis square-cube lov for spændinger, design/valg af kompositmaterialer, principper for anvendelse af elektronmikroskopi til karakterisering af metaller og kompositmaterialer. Generatortyper og virkemåde, den mekanisk-elektriske kobling mellem rotor og elnet, transmission, balanceringsproblemet i elnettet. Introduktion til videregående kurser og forskning i vindenergi.

courses.englishContents: Design of airfoils and wings, including the conceptual design of a drone. Introduction to the fundamental priciples and equations in aerodynamics. Incompressible airfoil theory. Potential flow - conformal mapping. the Kutta-Joukowsky theorem. Two-dimensional panel methods. Incompressible flow over finite wings. Lifting line/lifting surface models. Fundamentals of rotor aerodynamics.
courses.danishContents: Design af vingeprofiler og vinger samt konceptuelt design af en drone. Introduktion til de fundamentale aerodynamiske principper og ligninger. Inkompressibel profilteori. Potentialstrømning - konform afbildning. Kutta-Joukowsky’s teorem. To-dimensionale panelmetoder. Inkompressible strømninger over vinger af endelig spanvidde. Grundlæggende rotorteori.

courses.englishContents: Design codes for bottom fixed offshore wind turbines. Design basis for wind and wave climate. Extreme value prediction by fitted distributions. Substructure types for offshore wind turbines. Design of a substructure.Hydrodynamic loads from linear irregular waves. Wave kinematics and the Morison equation. Wheeler stretching and the MacCamy Fuchs diffraction theory. Simplified aerodynamic load model.The 1P and 3P dynamic criteria and basic technique for fatigue calculation.Wake aerodynamics and vortex structures behind a wind turbine rotor. 1D momentum theory for wakes. Wake interaction in wind farms. Methods for computation of wakes in wind farms.Introduction to planning and environmental decisions for offshore wind farms. Introduction to operation and maintenance management for offshore wind farms.Basic concepts for floating wind turbines and calculation of mooring forces. Linearised equations of motion for floating wind turbines. Dynamic stability and control of floating wind turbines.
courses.danishContents: Designnormer for bundfaste offshorevindmøller. Designbasis for wind and wave climate. Ekstremværdibestemmelse ved hjælp af fittede fordelinger. Fundamentstyper for offshore vindmøller. Design af et fundament.Hydrodynamiske laster fra lineære uregelmæssige bølger. Bølgekinematik og Morison-ligningen. Wheeler stretching og MacCamy Fuchs diffraktionsteori. Simpel vindlastmodel.1P og 3P frekvensernes samspil med den strukturelle dynamik og basale metoder til udmattelsesberegninger.Wake aerodynamik og hvirvelstrukturer bag vindmøllerotoren. 1D momentum teori for wakes. Wake interaktion i vindmølleparker. Metoder til numerisk beregning af wakes i vindparker.Introduktion til planlægning og miljømæssige beslutninger for offshore vindparker. Introduktion til drift og vedligeholdesesstrategier for offshore vindparker.Grundkoncepterne for flydende vindmøller og beregning af fortøjningskræfter. Lineariserede bevægelsesligninger for flydende vindmøller. Dynamisk stabilitet og kontrol for flydende vindmøller.

courses.englishContents: Placement: wind atlas, atmospheric boundary layer and turbulence, influence of the terrain and annual wind distribution. Aerodynamics: two-dimensional aerodynamics and three-dimensional effects. Use of strip theory to determine the energy production for a rotor with a given twist and chord distribution. Control of a wind turbine (stall-, pitch-, and variabel speed control). Structure: aerodynamic and inertial loads. Computation of the fatigue loads. Electrical conditions: 3 phase power system and concept of active and reactive power, calculation of electromagnetic components. Generator typologies including geared generators vs. direct drive generators, and converter connection vs. direct grid connection.Societal and industrial context, innovation and economics:history of wind power and industrial structure, energy and innovation policy context, innovation.
courses.danishContents: Aerodynamik: todimensional profilteori og tredimensionale effekter. Anvendelse af stripteori til bestemmelse af ydelsesberegninger for en rotor med given vridnings- og kordefordeling. Kontrol af vindmølle (stall, pitch eller variabel omløbshastighed). Struktur: aerodynamiske og inertielle laster. Udmattelsesberegninger af struktur. Placeringsproblematik: vindatlas, atmosfærisk grænselag og turbulens, terrænindflydelse og årlig vindfordeling.Elektriske forhold: 3 fase elsystemet og begrebet aktiv og reaktiv effekt,beregning af elektromagnetiske komponenter. Generatortopologier inkluderet generatorer med og uden gear, samt direkte tilsluttet og konverter tilsluttet.Samfundsmæssige og industrielle forhold, innovation og økonomi:vindkraftens historie og industristruktur, energi-og innovationspolitiske rammer, innovation.

courses.englishContents: This course uses the skills learned in 46300 as a springboard to deepen students’ practical knowledge of the interaction between aerodynamics, loads and controls during turbine design. Over the course of the semester, the students will work in groups to redesign the DTU 10 MW Reference Wind Turbine for a different wind class. The following topics will be covered: methods for redesigning a wind turbine rotor, wind turbine control basics and controller tuning, wind turbine dynamics and aeroelastic mode shapes, lifetime load calculations (fatigue + extreme), wind turbine certification standards and more.The theories, sub-models and methods introduced in this course are applicable for general modelling and analysis of wind turbines; however, the students will work with the multi-body code HAWC2 for aeroelastic simulations and with the analysis tool HAWCStab2 for aeroelastic modal analysis of wind turbines and controller tuning. Parts of this course will be provided through E-learning. The E-learning lessons correspond to a workload of approximately 15 hours.
courses.danishContents: Dette kursus anvender færdigheder fra 46300 for at udvide studerendes praktiske viden om interaktionerne mellem aerodynamik, last og kontrol igennem vindmølledesign. I løbet af semestret vil de studerende arbejde i grupper for at redesigne DTU 10 MW referencevindmøllen. Der undervises i de følgende emner: metoder for at redesigne en vindmøllerotor, grundlæggende af vindmøllekontrol og controller tuning, vindmølledynamik og aeroelastiske egensvingsningsformer, designlastberegninger (udmattelse og ekstrem), vindmøllecertifikation standarder og mere.Teorien, modeller og metoder introduceret i dette kursus kan andvendes til generel modellering og analyse af vindmøller. Dog vil de studerende arbejde med multi-body koden HAWC2 til aeroelastiske simuleringer og HAWCStab2 til aeroelastisk modalanalyse af vindmøller. Dele af dette kursus vil gennemføres som E-læring. E-læringstimerne svarer til en arbejdsbyde på ca. 15 timer.
courses.englishTitle: Loads, Aerodynamics and Control of Wind Turbines

courses.englishContents: The course will focus on the understanding of the structural response and failure of composite structures when exposed to loading. This will be done by providing the students with practical and computational methods to analyze and design these structures. Focus will partly be on the design of wind turbine blades, but the obtained knowledge will be relevant for the design of other types of composite structures.The course content is equally distributed between theoretical methods for analysis and the practical application of these methods in design. The following theoretical topics will be covered during this course:- Overview of composite science and technology (materials, manufacturing, applications);- Classical laminate theory (CLT);- Failure analysis (failure criteria, progressive damage/failure analysis, buckling, fatigue);- Beam and plate theory for monolithic fiber-reinforced composites;- Beam and plate theory for sandwich structures;- Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of composite structures (formulation, element technology);- Design and analysis of composite structures.Understanding and application of the above topics is achieved through practical exercises in design and failure of composite and sandwich components (FEA and programming in MatLab or similar).
courses.danishContents: Kurset vil fokusere på forståelsen af det strukturelle respons og svigt af kompositkonstruktioner udsat for belastning. Dette vil opnås ved at give de studerende praktiske og beregningsmæssige metoder til at analysere og designe disse strukturer. Fokus vil til dels være på design af vindmøllevinger, men den opnåede viden vil være relevant for design af andre typer af kompositkonstruktioner.Kursets indhold er ligeligt fordelt mellem teoretiske metoder til analyse og den praktiske anvendelse af disse metoder i design. Følgende teoretiske emner vil blive dækket i løbet kurset:- Oversigt over komposit videnskab og teknologi (materialer, produktion, applikationer);- Klassisk laminat teori;- Svigtanalyser (svigtkriterier progressiv skades-/svigt-analyse, buling, udmattelse);- Bjælke og pladeteori for monolitiske fiberforstærkede kompositter;- Bjælke og pladeteori for sandwichkonstruktioner;- Finite Element Analyse (FEA) af kompositkonstruktioner (formulering, element teknologi);- Design og analyse af kompositkonstruktionerForståelse og anvendelse af ovenstående emner opnås gennem praktiske øvelser i design og svigt af komposit og sandwich komponenter (FEA og programmering i Matlab eller lignende).

courses.englishContents: Introduction to strong and light materials;  theoretical maximum strength of materials;  the effect of defects on practical lower strength;  reinforcement of materials;  principles of reinforcement with inclusions, in particular fibres;  relevant fibres, their structure, fabrication, and properties;  statistical analysis of fibre strength;  volumetric composition of composite materials, in particular porosity; micromechanical models for composite materials;  load transfer between fibre and matrix; critical fibre length;  debonding and fibre pull-out energy for composite materials;  single and multiple fracture;  stiffness, strength and fracture energy for composite materials.
courses.danishContents: Introduktion til stærke og lette materialer;  teoretisk maksimal styrke af materialer;  defekter som årsag til praktisk lavere styrke;  forstærkning af materialer;  principper for forstærkning med inklusioner, især fibre;  relevante fibertyper, deres struktur, fremstilling og egenskaber;  statistisk analyse af styrkeværdier for fibre; volumetrisk sammensætning af kompositmaterialer, især porøsitet;  mikromekaniske modeller for kompositmaterialer;  kraftoverførsel mellem fibre og matrix;  kritisk fiberlængde;  debonding og pull-out energi for fiberkompositmaterialer;  single og multiple fracture;      stivhed, styrke og brudenergi for kompositmaterialer

courses.englishContents: There will be preliminary experiments to demonstrate relevant manufacturing methods used for assessment and choice of method and process parameters for the given component. The group should set up a plan for the experimental work and realization of the subject within the frame of the course. An introduction to basic design criteria for fiber composites will be given. Calculation of the stiffness of the composite will be compared with the specific stiffness of the test subjects to assess the plan for the manufacture of composite items. Thus, students will be able to explain the necessary quantity of material and plan a manufacturing process based on relevant process parameters.
courses.danishContents: Der vil være indledende forsøg til at demonstrere udvalgte fremstillingsmetoder, der benyttes til vurdering og valg af metode og procesparametre for den givne komponent. Ud fra dette skal gruppen udforme en plan for forsøgsarbejdet og fremstillingen af emnet inden for kursets rammer. Indføring i grundlæggende designkriterier for fiberkompositter. Beregninger for stivheden af komposit vil blive sammenlignet med den specifikke stivhed af testemner til vurdering af planen for fremstillingen af kompositemnerne. Således vil de studerende blive i stand til at redegøre for den nødvendige materialemængde samt planlægge en fremstillingsproces ud fra relevante procesparametre.

courses.englishContents: Aero-acustics concepts, Linear wave equation and acoustic analogy, Noise mechamisms of wind turbines, noise prediction models, low noise wind turbine design, noise measurements, noise propagation, parabolic wave equations, noise propagation models, computational aero-acoustics, noise perception and regulations, noise reduction techniques
courses.danishContents: Aeroakustiske koncepter, linære bølgeligninger og akustisk analogi, støjmekanismer i vindmøller, støjforudsigende modeller, design af lydsvage vindmøller, støjmålinger, støjudbredelse, paraboliske bølgeligninger. Støjudbredelsesmodeller. Beregningsbaseret aeroakustik, forudsigelse og opfattelse af støj samt støjgrænser.  Støjregulerende teknikker.

courses.englishContents: Participation in a research project in close collaboration with a supervisor who could be a PhD student from the department. The exact content of the project will be further agreed upon with the supervisor. The main points of the scientific issue must be communicated orally to the other participants of the course. The project results and method must be communicated in a final, written hand-in.
courses.danishContents: Deltagelse i et forskningsprojekt i tæt samarbejde med en vejleder som kan være en ph.d.-studerende på instituttet. Det nøjagtige indhold af projektet vil blive aftalt med vejlederen. De vigtigste punkter i det videnskabelige spørgsmål præsenteres mundtligt for de øvrige deltagere i kurset. Projektets resultater og metode bliver præsenteret i en afsluttende skriftlig aflevering.

courses.englishContents: The course covers a wide range of subjects in the field of wind energy, including siting and integration, offshore wind energy, wind turbine technology and materials and structures. These topics are presented by a series of researchers who actively work on these topics. The purpose of the course is to ensure that the PhD students within the field of wind energy research are well-informed in all areas of wind energy, including areas they do not specialize in. During the course, the students will work on a surrogate research project covering several research topics within wind energy, in teams chosen in agreement with the course responsible. The outcome of the work will be a report and a presentation. It is expected that the students prepare themselves by reading the provided background material.
courses.danishTitle: Forskning i vindenergi - udfordringer og metoder
courses.danishContents: Kurset dækker en bred vifte af emner inden for vindenergi, herunder placering og integration, offshore vindkraft, vindmølle teknologi og materialer og strukturer. Disse emner præsenteres af en række forskere, der arbejder aktivt med disse emner. Formålet med kurset er at sikre, at ph.d.-studerende inden for vindenergiforskning er velinformerede på alle områder af vindenergi, herunder områder, som de ikke specialiserer sig i.I løbet af kurset vil de studerende arbejde på et surrogatforskningsprojekt, der dækker flere forskningsemner inden for vindenergi, i hold valgt efter aftale med kursansvarlig. Resultatet af arbejdet vil være en rapport og en præsentation. Det forventes, at eleverne forbereder sig ved at læse det medfølgende baggrundsmateriale.
courses.englishTitle: Research in Wind Energy - challenges and methods

courses.englishContents: The course consists of four modules. For the each module, the student reads relevant literature and/or prepares a presentation or document to discuss in dialogue with the teacher (the supervisor) and a longer meeting. The topics considered in the four modules are:1.	What is a PhD study at DTU?2.	What project management tools are useful for our PhD project?3.	What are the objectives and outcomes of your PhD project?4.	What are the risks and how do you plan your PhD project?The first module is based on the “Qualification Framework” (learning objectives) of DTU, the Ministerial Order, and DTU’s PhD guide. The student and the supervisor create an overview of the official requirements, draw a timeline for a typical PhD project, and discuss the mutual expectations and responsibilities. The second module is based on the book “Lean Innovation” by Claus Sehested and Henrik Sonnenberg, as well as the Project Guidelines from DTU Wind Energy. The project specific relevance and usefulness of the general project tools such as “front-loading”, “stakeholder analysis”, “risk analysis”, and “sprint-planning” are discussed, and agreements on the supervision and project follow-ups are made. At the third module, the student presents a preliminary literature study within the scientific field of the project, and the objectives and contributions (possibly in terms of tentative paper titles) are identified and broken down into smaller parts. At the fourth module, the student presents a Gantt chart of a suggested project plan, which contains milestones and deliverables defined in the previous module. The risks of the different work parts are discussed with the supervisor and necessary corrections are made to the project plan.
courses.danishTitle: Projektplanlægning for ph.d.-studerende ved DTU Vindenergi
courses.danishContents: se engelsk beskrivelse
courses.englishTitle: Project planning for PhD Students at DTU Wind Energy

courses.englishContents: The background and challenges in relation to the energy system are outlined with a view to climate, resources and security of supply. Key concepts and principles of thermodynamics and electrochemistry necessary to discuss and understand energy technologies are presented. The most important energy sources and their technologies for exploitation are introduced (i.e. solar, wind, hydro power, biomass and nuclear). Energy conversion and storage is treated as a means for handling energy on the large scale. It covers physical and in particular chemical storage (electrolyzers, fuel cells, power to fuel concepts, batteries, chemical storage)
courses.danishContents: Baggrunden og udfordringerne i relation til energisystemet skitseres med henblik på klima, ressourcer og forsyningssikkerhed. Nøglebegreber og principper for termodynamik og elektrokemi, der er nødvendige for at kunne diskutere og forstå energiteknologier, præsenteres. De vigtigste energikilder og deres teknologier til udnyttelse introduceres (dvs. sol, vind, vandkraft, biomasse og atomkraft). Energikonvertering og -lagring behandles som et middel til håndtering af energi i stor skala. Det dækker fysisk og især kemisk lagring (elektrolyseceller, brændselsceller, begreber inden for 'strøm til brændstof', batterier, kemisk lagring)

courses.englishContents: You will work with a PhD student/postdoc/researcher/senior researcher/associate professor on experimental work in an ongoing research project in which the supervising PhD student/postdoc/researcher/senior researcher/associate professor is involved. The specific topic for the course will depend on the ongoing projects in the department and will be related to one of the key technologies that we are working with in DTU Energy. The technologies are (read more here: http://www.energy.dtu.dk/english/Research):• Fuel cells• Electrolysis• Batteries• Membranes for gas separation• Magnetic refrigeration• Thermoelectrical components• Flue gas purification• Superconducting componentsShortly after the deadline for sign-up via the Studyplanner, you will be asked to send an overview of the courses you have taken during your study at DTU (or another university). We wil hereafter match students with an appropriate supervisor and research project.
courses.danishContents: Du kommer til at arbejde med en ph.d.-studerende/postdoc/forsker/seniorforsker/lektor med eksperimentelt arbejde i et igangværende forskningsprojekt, som din vejleder for 3-ugers perioden er involveret i.Det specifikke emne for kurset vil afhænge af det igangværende projekt i DTU Energi og vil blive en af de teknologier, som vi arbejder med i DTU Energi. Teknologierne, og dermed mulige emner for 3-ugers perioden, er følgende (læs mere her: http://www.energy.dtu.dk/Forskning):• Brændselsceller• Elektrolyse• Batterier• Membraner til gasseparation• Magnetisk køling• Termoelektriske komponenter• Røggasrensning• Superledende komponenterKort efter fristen for tilmelding via studieplanlæggeren vil du blive bedt om at sende en oversigt over de kurser, du har taget i løbet af dit studium ved DTU (eller andet universitet). Vi vil herefter matche studerende med en passende vejleder og projekt.
courses.englishTitle: Research immersion – Department of Energy Conversion and Storage

courses.englishContents: The course will consist of short lectures, computer exercises, plenum discussions, experimental data collection in the lab and a final project. The lectures provide short introductions to new topics and central concepts. The exercises are primarily programming based and consist in implementing and analysing the properties of different methods in small groups. Experimental 3D data will be collected at a session in the DTU 3D Imaging Centre. The final part of the course is a group project on a problem from a predefined pool of problems or a self-selected problem.
courses.danishTitle: Kvantitative målinger på materialer ud fra 3D billeder
courses.danishContents: Kurset består af korte forelæsninger, computerøvelser, plenumdiskussioner, dataindsamling i laboratoriet og et afsluttende projekt. Forelæsningerne giver korte introduktioner til nye emner og centrale begreber. Øvelserne er primært programmeringsbaserede og består i at implementere og analysere egenskaberne af forskellige metoder i små grupper. 3D-data indsamles ved et kort forløb i 3D Imaging Centret. Den sidste del af kurset er et gruppeprojekt om et problem fra en foruddefineret pulje af problemformuleringer eller en selvvalgt problemformulering.
courses.englishTitle: Quantitative measurements on materials from 3D images

courses.englishContents: The course is based on project-organized learning. Throughout the course, the students will work in groups. Each group is given a material, which they will work with. We intend to offer materials with relevance to the students’ study lines. In the groups, the students decide which information that is relevant to extract from the 3D structure of their material, and what kind of modelling they would like to perform. In the lab, the groups will use an x-ray CT scanner to record data that they reconstruct, segment and analyse. The last part of the analysis will be to apply modelling of physical properties of a material in 3D. To support the project-organized learning, theoretical lectures, online material such as videos and small exercises will be given. The lectures and videos will describe the principles behind each practical step (x-ray experiment, reconstruction, segmentation, analysis, modelling). The course provides students with a basic understanding of and skills to operate x-ray CT scanners and relevant software for reconstruction and analysis. The students will exercise their skills in data analysis. Across the groups, the students will interact by giving peer feedback and oral presentations.
courses.danishContents: Kurset er baseret på projektorienteret læring. Gennem kurset vil de studerende arbejde i grupper. Hver gruppe får et materiale, som de skal arbejde med. Vi vil forsøge at give materialer, som er relevante for de studerendes studieretninger. I grupperne skal de studerende beslutte, hvilken information de vil forsøge at trække ud af 3D strukturerne i deres materiale, og hvilke type modellering de vil anvende. I laboratorierne skal grupperne arbejde med en røntgen CT scanner til at optage billeder af materialet. Grupperne skal rekonstruere billederne til et 3D-datasæt, som de skal segmentere og analysere. Den sidste del af dataanalysen vil være at anvende modellering af nogle af de fysiske egenskaber for materialet i 3D. For at understøtte den projektorienterede læring vil der blive givet forelæsninger, online materiale som f.eks. videoer og små øvelser. Forelæsningerne og videoerne vil beskrive principperne bag de enkelte praktiske trin (røntgen eksperimenter, rekonstruktion, segmentering, analyse, modellering). Kurset giver de studerende en basal forståelse for og evne til at kunne bruge røntgen CT scannere og relevant software til rekonstruktion og analyse. De studerende vil få erfaring med dataanalyse. De studerende vil samarbejde på tværs af grupperne ved at give peer feedback og mundtlige præsentationer.

courses.englishContents: The course is formulated into three projects and a group report is expected for each:Project 1. Preparation and characterization of platinum catalyst, ion conducting membrane, electrodes and a PEM fuel cell. Project 2. Preparation of methanol reforming catalyst. Construction of laboratory reactor (reformer) with measurement and control of temperature. Test of methanol reformer. Integration and operation of fuel cells and reformer. Project 3. Preparation and characterization of catalyst and electrodes and test of water electrolyzer.
courses.danishContents: Kurset er opdelt i tre projekter og der forventes en grupperapport for hvert. Projekt 1. Fremstilling og karakterisering af platinkatalysator, ionledende membran, elektroder og hel PEM-brændselscelle. Test af brændselscelle. Projekt 2. Fremstilling af methanolreformerkatalysator. Konstruktion af labreaktor (reformer) med måling og kontrol af temperatur. Test af methanolreformer. Integration og drift af brændselscelle og reformer. projekt 3. Fremstilling og karakterisering af katalysator og elektroder samt test af vandelektrolysator.
courses.englishTitle: Hydrogen and fuel cell chemistry - experimental course

courses.englishContents: Properties of ceramic materials: physical, thermal, mechanical, electric, magnetic, chemical. Phase diagrams (binary and ternary), crystal structures.Treatment of ceramic powders and glass production. Shaping of ceramics: pressing, casting, plastic forming. Drying and sintering of ceramic bodies, glass production.Characterization of ceramics: X-ray diffraction, differential thermal analysis, thermal expansion (dilatometer), particle size and particle size distribution, measurement of strength, toughness and hardness, surface area (BET), porosimetry, optic microscopy, electron microscopy, Raman spectroscopy.Toughening of ceramics. Design of ceramics.
courses.danishContents: Egenskaber af keramiske materialer: fysiske, termiske, mekaniske, elektriske, magnetiske, kemiske. Fasediagrammer (binære og ternære), krystalstrukturer.Behandling af keramiske pulvere og glas. Formning af keramik: presning, støbning, plastisk faconpresning. Tørring og sintring af keramiske legemer, glasproduktion.Karakterisering af keramik: røntgendiffraktion, differentiel termisk analyse, termisk ekspansion (dilatometer), partikelstørrelse og partikelstørrelsesfordeling, måling af styrke, sejhed og hårdhed, overfladeareal (BET), porøsimetri, optisk mikroskopi, elektronmikroskopi, Raman-spektroskopi.Tiltag der øger materialets brudsejhed. Design af keramik.

courses.englishContents: Potential gains, materials and technical challenges in using hydrogen as an energy carrier. Current and future energy resources. Energy efficiency. Materials for hydrogen storage. Phase diagrams. Ab-/desorption kinetics. X-ray diffraction. Reference electrodes. Electrocatalyst/electrode kinetics. Tafel slope. Exchange current density.The course consists of two topics (see general course objectives above), each of which consists of two days with lectures and group exercises, five days with experimental activities and one day for writing of the report.
courses.danishTitle: Materialer til produktion og lagring af brint
courses.danishContents: Muligheder og tekniske udfordringer ved brug af brint som energibærer. Nuværende og fremtidige energiressourcer. Energieffektivitet. Brintlagringsmaterialer. Fasediagrammer. Absorptions-/desorptionskinetik. Røntgendiffraktion (XRD).Referenceelektroder. Elektrokatalysator/elektrodekinetik. Tafelhældning. Udveksling af strømtæthed.Kurset dækker to temaer (beskrevet under overordnede kursusmål ovenfor), der hvert især består af to dage med forelæsninger og gruppeopgaver, fem dage med eksperimenter og en dag til rapportskrivning.
courses.englishTitle: Materials for hydrogen production and storage

courses.englishContents: The course is based on a combination of theoretical lectures, numerical and image-based exercises and case studies performed in small project groups. The lectures provide the physical mechanisms describing the interactions between electrons and solid state energy materials and the foundations of microscopy-based analysis techniques. The exercises will provide understanding of the practised analysis techniques, and the case studies are based on actual problems encountered in renewable energy materials. The course provides students with the skills to analyse, explain and conclude, with respect to state-of-the-art analysis techniques, and with methodologies to solve specific problems within energy materials. Reports based on the case studies will provide students with feedback in the form of continuous assessment throughout the course.
courses.danishTitle: Analytisk imaging af energimaterialer med elektronmikroskopi
courses.danishContents: Kurset er bygget op om en kombination af teoretiske forelæsninger, regneøvelser og case studier, der behandles i mindre projektgrupper. Forelæsningerne giver de fysiske mekanismer for vekselvirkningen mellem elektroner og faste stoffer samt de relaterede principper bag analyseteknikkerne. Regneøvelserne skal træne forståelsen og anvendelsen af analyseteknikkerne. Case-studierne, der tager udgangspunkt i aktuelle problemstillinger i forståelsen af bæredygtige energimaterialer, skal give de studerende mulighed for at analysere, forklare og konkludere i forhold til, hvilke analytiske billeddannende teknikker, der med fordel kan anvendes i en given problemstilling.
courses.englishTitle: Analytical imaging of energy materials by electron micrsocopy

courses.englishContents: The course comprises a series of lectures, tutorials, and hands-on computational assignments. The lectures will provide necessary domain knowledge and will cover the following topics:Introduction to materials simulations. Basics of density functional theory and molecular dynamics. Electronic structure of energy materials. Statistical thermodynamics and transition state theory. Adsorption and diffusion on surfaces. Scaling relations and volcano plots in catalysis. Computational electrochemistry. Band alignment in solar cells. Charge transport in batteries. Electronic processes in organic energy materials. Kinetic Monte Carlo simulations. Tutorials and assignments will focus on practical applications of computational tools to study selected energy materials.
courses.danishTitle: Avancerede metoder til computersimuleringer af energimaterialer
courses.danishContents: Kurset omfatter en række forelæsninger, tutorials og praktiske beregningsopgaver. Forelæsningerne vil give den nødvendige domæneviden og vil dække følgende emner:Introduktion til materialesimuleringer. Grundlæggende tæthedsfunktionalteori og molekylærdynamik. Elektronstruktur af energimaterialer. Statistisk termodynamik og Transition State-teori. Adsorption og diffusion på overflader. Skaleringsrelationer og aktivitetsvulkaner i katalyse. Computersimulering af elektrokemi. Båndtilpasning i solceller. Ladningstransport i batterier. Elektroniske processer i organiske energimaterialer. Kinetic Monte Carlo simuleringer.Tutorials og opgaver fokuserer på anvendelser af beregningsværktøjer til at studere udvalgte energimaterialer.
courses.englishTitle: Advanced computational tools for energy materials

courses.englishContents: The course is divided in four modules with the following themes.1. Organic chemistry and materials (covalent bonding, structure-properties relationships, polymers)2. Physical and electrochemistry (laws of gases, phase diagrams, thermodynamics, thermochemistry, redox and electrochemistry 3. Surface, catalysis and fuel chemistry (surfaces and interfaces, heterogeneous catalysis, fuel chemistry)4. Inorganic materials (forms of carbon, metals, alloys, ceramics)
courses.danishContents: Kurset er opdelt i fire moduler med følgende temaer:1. Organisk kemi og materialer (kovalent binding, strukturegenskabsforhold, polymerer)2. Fysisk- og elektrokemi (gasser, fasediagrammer, termodynamik, termokemi, redox og elektrokemi)3. Overflade, katalyse og brændstofkemi (overflader og grænseflader, heterogen katalyse, brændstofkemi)4. Uorganiske materialer (kulstoffer, metaller,  legeringer, keramik)

courses.englishContents: You will work with a postdoc/researcher/senior researcher/associate professor on experimental work in an ongoing research project in which the supervising postdoc/researcher/senior researcher/associate professor is involved. The specific topic for the course will depend on the ongoing projects in the department and will be related to one of key technologies that we are working with in DTU Energy. The technologies are (read more here: http://www.energy.dtu.dk/english/Research):• Fuel cells• Electrolysis• Batteries• Membranes for gas separation• Magnetic refrigeration• Thermoelectrical components• Flue gas purification• Superconductivity• PhotocatalysisShortly after the deadline for sign-up via the Studyplanner, you will be asked to send an overview of the courses you have taken during your study at DTU (or another university). We will hereafter match students with an appropriate supervisor and research project.
courses.danishContents: Du kommer til at arbejde med en postdoc/forsker/seniorforsker/lektor med eksperimentelt arbejde i et igangværende forskningsprojekt, i hvilket din vejleder i 3-ugers perioden er involveret.Det specifikke emne for kurset/dit projekt vil afhænge af igangværende projekter i DTU Energi og vil ligge inden for en af de teknologier, som vi arbejder med i DTU Energi. Teknologierne er følgende (læs mere her: http://www.energy.dtu.dk/Forskning):• Brændselsceller• Elektrolyse• Batterier• Membraner til gasseparation• Magnetisk køling• Termoelektriske komponenter• Røggasrensning• Superledning• FotokatalyseKort efter fristen for tilmelding via studieplanlæggeren vil du blive bedt om at sende et liste over de kurser, du har taget i løbet af dit studium ved DTU (eller andet universitet). Vi vil herefter matche studerende med en passende vejleder og projekt.
courses.englishTitle: Research immersion – Department of Energy Conversion and Storage

courses.englishContents: An introduction to key concepts of superconductivity is given with focus on critical parameters. Project parts: project planning, literature study, conduct an experimental project, write a scientific article/report and project presentation technique. The experimental project content is chosen with a focus on either simulation or hands-on. The project report is constructed as a scientific article and the content is presented at the examination.
courses.danishContents: Kurset giver en introduktion til nøglebegreber for superledere med vægt på kritiske parametre. De eksperimentelle projekters indhold vælges med fokus på enten simulering eller hands-on. Rapporten udformes som en videnskabelig artikel, og denne præsenteres individuelt til eksamen.

courses.englishContents: The course will explain the basic principles of electricity storage and heat storage technologies and their role in the present and future sustainable energy system. An overview of the different storage methods will be given followed by studies of the different types in detail. Electrochemical energy storage using conventional batteries, flow batteries and electrolysers will be described in terms of thermodynamics, operating principles, efficiency, lifetime, energy density and storage duration. Other electrical storage technologies including pumped hydro, compressed air, flywheels and supercapacitors will be introduced and compared. Heat storage using hot water tanks and pits, phase-change materials, aquifers and stones will be similarly explained. Design criteria and examples of simulations and techno-economics calculations e.g. to determine feasible storage solutions for certain applications and scenarios will be given. Finally, new storage technologies and opportunities for storage will be discussed.
courses.danishContents: Dette kursus vil forklare de grundlæggende principper for teknologier til lagring af elektricitet og varme og deres rolle i det nuværende og fremtidige bæredygtige energisystem. Der gives et overblik over forskellige lagringsmetoder efterfulgt af studier af udvalgte typer i større detalje. Elektrokemisk energilagring ved anvendelse af konventionelle batterier, flow-batterier og elektrolysatorer vil blive beskrevet i termodynamisk perspektiv, driftsprincipper, effektivitet, levetid, energitæthed og lagringsvarighed. Andre elektriske lagringsteknologier, herunder ”pumped hydro”, tryksat luft, svinghjul og superkapacitorer, vil blive introduceret og sammenlignet. Varmelagring ved anvendelse af varmtvandsbeholdere og gruber, faseændringsmaterialer, grundvandsmagasiner og sten vil også blive gennemgået. Designkriterier og eksempler på simuleringer og teknoøkonomiske udregninger fx for at kunne fastlægge mulige lagringsløsninger til specifikke anvendelser og scenarier vil blive gennemgået. Afslutningsvis vil nye lagringsteknologier og muligheder blive diskuteret.

courses.englishContents: The course covers a wide range of subjects in the field of energy conversion and storage, including fuel cells, batteries, solar cells and caloric energy conversion. These topics are presented by a series of researchers who actively work on these topics. The purpose of the course is to ensure that the PhD students within the field of energy research are well-informed in all areas of energy conversion and storage, including areas they do not specialize in. The specific content of the course changes from semester to semester depending on the teachers and guests participating in the course, and depending on the interests of the participating students. Additionally, the course will contain presentations on innovation and patent issues, scientific communication, and proper scientific and ethical conduct. During the course, a student will give two presentations. One will be a short summary of his/her PhD project; the other will be on a topic within energy conversion and storage currently unknown to the student, chosen in agreement with the course responsibles. One of these presentations must be accompanied by a short (3 page) description of the technology. It is expected that the students prepare themselves for each of the presentations by reading background material. For the oral exam, a student will choose a number of the other students' presentations, one of which will be randomly chosen at the oral exam, where the student must then explain the main topics and ideas of the presentation. A scientific article within energy conversion and storage, given to the student in advance of the exam, must also be presented at the oral exam.

Formålet med kurset er at sikre, at de ph.d.-studerende inden for energiforskning er velorienterede inden for alle områder af energikonvertering og -lagring, også de områder de ikke selv er specialiserede i. Det konkrete indhold af kurset veksler fra semester til semester afhængigt af lærerne og gæster, der deltager i kurset, og også afhængigt af de deltagende studerendes interesser.Derudover vil kurset indeholde oplæg om innovation og patentering, videnskabelig kommunikation og korrekt videnskabelig og etisk adfærd.I løbet af kurset skal den studerende give to præsentationer. Den ene skal være en kort præsentation af ph.d.-projektet, mens den anden skal være i et for den studerende ukendt emne inden for energikonvertering of -lagring, valgt i samarbejde med de kursusansvarlige. En af disse præsentationer skal underbygges med en kort (3 sider) beskrivelse af teknologien. Det forventes, at de studerende forbereder sig på de enkelte præsentationer ved at læse baggrundsmateriale.Til den mundtlige eksamen vælger den studerende et antal af de andre studerendes præsentationer, hvoraf én trækkes tilfældigt til eksamen. Den studerende skal så kunne redegøre for dette emne. En videnskabelig artikel inden for energikonvertering og -lagring, som den studerende får udleveret et par dage før den mundtlige eksamen, skal også præsenteres ved den mundtlige eksamen.

courses.englishContents: The transition of the energy sector from fossil based fuels and resources to renewable resources and energy will significantly change the energy system of the future. Several technologies with different technology readiness levels are currently under development to make this transition happen, however technical solutions and concepts still have to be developed and benchmarked against each other and existing technologies. But what are sustainable renewable resources and which technologies are sustainable in the longrun? In a project based approach the course will provide an inside into the various technical concepts for synthetic fuels and chemicals based on renewable and bio resources. A focal point is on the increased electrification and the options for chemical energy storage and commodity chemical production.The course consists of lectures addressing the general concepts and methodologies as well as individual student projects, addressing  selected topic related to the synthesis of sustainable fuels and chemicals. The students will chose a specific topic or research project  of interest  to be analyzed more in detail especially as regards the technical concept and the sustainability aspects, and to be presented and discussed in plenum.

courses.englishContents: The students work together in groups that are put together so that all students in the group have the same 2nd foreign language. This other project group has the task of providing critical / elaborate / clarifying questions to the project report at the exam with the course supervisors. (Each group has two tasks - writing a report yourself - and reading / asking questions for another group's report). See also below Test form and remarks.

courses.englishContents: Computer Networking: The internet protocol stack and the most commonly used protocols in the internet protocol stack. Wired as well as wireless communication standards. Introduction to the term cloud computing.International marketing: Teaching in the use of macro meso and micro tools in connection with international market analysis. Evaluation of the company's international competitiveness using Michael Porter's theories. Selection of distribution channel and management in relation to the desire for control over financial capacity. Possible use of protection policies for the company based on the use of patents. Developments in e-business and m-commerce and consideration of the company's business use. Furthermore, increasing focus on the individual customer, including the use of customer relationship management and social media.International economy: The national economy is rich in conflicts about what resources need to be used and how to control it; But the whole worth is in the sign of change. EMU and euro have been incorporated and have been central to the debate; But globalization is not only a key to wealth but also to conflict. Each country's fiscal and monetary policy must be aligned with both fixed and floating rates and the EU's approach to a merged entity calls for all kinds of assessments. By using the sharp cutting tools of economic theory, conflicts can be made clear and much of the uncertainty removed. Economic theory can give students a relevant understanding of the basis for decision making.Methodological considerations for use in project work.
courses.danishTitle: International Markedsføring, International Økonomi, Computer Netværk
courses.danishContents: Netværksteori / IT:  Internettets almindeligt anvendte applikationsprotokoller. Internettets TCP/IP protokoller. Beskrivelse af virkemåden af såvel kablede som trådløse kommunikationsstandarder. Fokus lægges på begreber som protokoller og interfacing og en samlet forståelse af internettets protokolstak. Desuden gives et godt overblik over specielt de mest anvendte mobile kommunikationsstander. Introduktion til begrebet Cloud Computing.International markedsføring: Undervisning i brug af makro- og mikroværktøjer i forbindelse med international markedsanalyse. Vurdering af virksomhedens internationale konkurrenceevne ved hjælp af Michael Porters teorier. Valg af distributionskanal og styring i forhold til ønske om kontrol overfor økonomisk formåen. Mulige anvendelser af beskyttelsespolitikker for virksomheden med udgangspunkt i brug af patenter.Udviklingen indenfor e-business og m-commerce og overvejelser omkring virksomhedens forretningsmæssige brug heraf. Endvidere forårsager et stigende fokus på den enkelte kunde, et relationsmarkedsføring fokus, herunder brug af customer relationship management og sociale medier.International økonomi: Den nationale økonomi er rig på konflikter om, hvad ressourcerne skal bruges til, og hvordan der skal styres; men hele verdnen er i forandringens tegn. ØMU og euro er blevet indarbejdet og har fået en central placering i debatten; men globalisering er ikke kun en nøgle til velstand, men også til konflikt. Det enkelte lands finans- og pengepolitik skal afstemmes med hensyn til såvel faste som flydende kurser og EU's vej mod en sammensvejset enhed påkalder sig alle slags vurderinger. Ved at anvende den økonomiske teoris skarpt skærende redskaber kan konflikterne gøres overskuelige og meget af usikkerheden fjernes. Den økonomiske teori kan give de studerende en relevant forståelse for det beslutningsgrundlag, de politiske valg træffes på.Metodeovervejelser til brug i projektarbejde.
